alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 22 at 4:38AM PDT until March 23 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches from 5000 to 6000 feet, 8 to 12 inches from 6000 to 7500 feet, with 12 to 18 inches on the highest peaks. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...San Bernardino County Mountains. * WHEN...Until 5 AM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will mostly fluctuate between 4000 and 4500 feet.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
